means: 发现( discover的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He succeeded with the aid of a completely new method he discovered.
sentence.Network_cn: 借助于自己发现的一种全新的方法，他获得了成功。

sentence.Network_en: I discovered my husband rifling through the filing cabinet.
sentence.Network_cn: 我发现我丈夫正在档案柜里匆匆翻找着什么东西。

sentence.Network_en: He surmised that he had discovered one of the illegal streets.
sentence.Network_cn: 他推测自己已经发现了一条非法活动猖獗的街道。

discovered by outsiders in 1979 , the crested iguana's numbers are rapidly dwindling due to the brisk spread of introduced species , such as feral cats and black rats .冠鬣蜥自1979年被来自岛外的人们发现以来，由于随之引入的例如野猫和黑鼠等外来物种的迅速蔓延，他们的数量正在急剧缩减。
(PCV2) is a new virus which the recent years discovered.猪圆环病毒（PCV2）是近年来发现的一种新病毒。
Tea was discovered and utilization , about four or five thousand years of history ., 茶被人类发现和利用 , 大约有四五千年的历史.

list.abs: this tool will help you discover who links to your web site ., 这个工具将帮助你发现那些链接你的网站.
When we were on the Ferris wheel , I discovered my fear of heights ., 当我们坐摩天轮的时候 , 我发现我有恐高症.
on fire是什么意思啊？_百度知道 ... not...until 直到...才 be discovered 被发现 oven on open fire 在篝火上的炉.
美国旅游推展协会（Discover America）于7╱7举办季会，此次季会新加入成员为行健旅行社。关于今年POW WOW旅展，联合航空台 …

entry.tran: 发现(以前不知道的事实)
entry.def: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.

example.tran: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。

entry.tran: (偶然)发现;找到(一直在寻找的某人或某物)
entry.def: If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.

example.ex: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.
example.tran: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。

entry.def: When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.

example.tran: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人

example.ex: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。

entry.tran: 初次接触(某活动并乐在其中)
entry.def: If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.

example.ex: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...
example.tran: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。

example.ex: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
example.tran: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

entry.tran: 发现，发掘(不为人所知的演员、音乐人等艺人)
entry.def: When an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.

example.ex: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。

means.word_mean: 1. no longer concealed; uncovered as by opening a curtain; `discovered' is archaic and primarily a theater term;

sentences.sentence: "the scene disclosed was of a moonlit forest"

means.word_mean: 2. discovered or determined by scientific observation;

sentences.sentence: "variation in the ascertained flux depends on a number of factors"

auth_sentence.content: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.
auth_sentence.res_content: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To have discovered this huge timber shipway was extraordinary.

auth_sentence.content: It was the first satellite to be discovered photographically.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was the first satellite to be discovered photographically.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was the first satellite to be discovered photographically.

auth_sentence.content: That there's plenty more oil to be discovered.
auth_sentence.res_content: That there's plenty more oil to be discovered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That there's plenty more oil to be discovered.

Sentence.sentence: Part of your point you knew before hand but part you discovered as you wrote.
Although no form of matter yet discovered moves as fast as or faster than light, scientific experiments have already confirmed that accelerated motion causes a traveler's time to be stretched
He has discovered it – babies don't even know that language exists – and he has found out how it works and learnt to use it appropriately.
All the causes of the sickness are not discovered yet.
Ted Hughes discovered many long poems submitted for poetry competition were composed on computers
After making inquiries Hughes discovered that they were being composed on computers, then just finding their way into British homes.
